channel.title: Maths Yr 12
channel.description:
These are some questions I got to answer for a maths assignment I'm in year 12 I thought posting here would be more fun then google'ing it so yeah. The questions aren't that hard.
1. Name four situations where you may use a credit card or debit card?
2. What is a majour difference between a credit card and a debit card?
3. What is the formula that is used to convert between the annual rate and the daily rate?
4. What is the minimum age at which someone may apply for a credit car? For a debit card? (IN Australia)
5. With some cards it is possible t obtain credit for up to 55 days interest free on the purchase f good. Eplain clearly how this is possible.
6. Some stores operate their own credit cards. List the advantages and disadvantages in using a store's credit card over one issued by a bank or building society.
7. Name four different credit cards that can be used internationally to purchase goods overseas \.
Thanks if anyone knows the answers !!
If you answer a question post your age =P I wanna see how easy this maths really is.
This is only one part of the assignment though..And the easiest part TBH.

item.title: Maths Yr 12
item.dc:creator: @awesom awesom
item.description:
@awesom wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:10, topic:133794”]My Junior year is going to cover AP Calculus BC, then my senior year I will take AP statistics.

Since when has Credit Card age requirements had anything to do with this? 5 of these questions are completely irrelevant to mathematics.[/quote]

Because the assignment is about learning about credit cards so you don’t fall into huge debt by using then.

item.title: Maths Yr 12
item.dc:creator: @sup000 sup000
item.description:
@sup000 wrote:

[quote=“awesom, post:1, topic:133794”]These are some questions I got to answer for a maths assignment I’m in year 12 I thought posting here would be more fun then google’ing it so yeah. The questions aren’t that hard.

  1. Name four situations where you may use a credit card or debit card?

  2. What is a majour difference between a credit card and a debit card?

  3. What is the formula that is used to convert between the annual rate and the daily rate?

  4. What is the minimum age at which someone may apply for a credit car? For a debit card? (IN Australia)

  5. With some cards it is possible t obtain credit for up to 55 days interest free on the purchase f good. Eplain clearly how this is possible.

  6. Some stores operate their own credit cards. List the advantages and disadvantages in using a store’s credit card over one issued by a bank or building society.

  7. Name four different credit cards that can be used internationally to purchase goods overseas .

Thanks if anyone knows the answers !!

If you answer a question post your age =P I wanna see how easy this maths really is.

This is only one part of the assignment though…And the easiest part TBH.[/quote]

  1. for anything. you name 4, they will be right.
  2. Credit cards are a credit balance acruing intrest on the balance outstanding monthly, the money is never yours. A debit card reduced from your bank balance to an agreed limit.
    3.i dont understand what rate we are talking about
    4.18 in UK.
  3. In UK companies offer intrest free on purchaces and balance transfers normally for 6months, but upto a year. This makes it very easy, and seems cheap, for the user, building up a high debt, which will pay intrest after the introductory period. And wam, they got you, at 29.9% pa
    6.sometimes higher rates on store cards. store cards may offer loyalty points. any other?
  4. mastercard, visa, Maestro, Solo, Barclaycard

I </3 credit

Read full topic

Debit card allows you to spend the amount of the money you have in your bank account, but credit card has credit like if you have 250$ in your account and you’re buying a new pc which costs 600$ then it’s like loaning 350$ from the bank so you will have to pay the 350$ back to the bank.
